title: The Ultimate Picnic Packing List
description: After many years of tinkering, I finally created what I consider the Ultimate Picnic Packing List to reference whenever I pack a picnic. As always, I separated my list into Must Haves/ Do You Needs? If you are planning any type of picnic adventure, go to the START here section of The Ultimate Picnic Packing List! ASK YOURSELF: Who is going? Not on the list, but you know, you should know. Where is your picnic? How long will it last? What’s the weather? Here are all of my essentials! a sun hat! a picnic basket – Mine is an old shopping basket. a beach towel – helps with cleanup, can also be a blanket or tablecloth if need be! a blanket (that rolls up!)– always important to have one. I actually leave one in my car at all times. You never know! portable Bluetooth speaker (it has a battery pack!) food bag art supply bag essentials dopp kit cooler bag I can carry it all from the car to our destination. I’m wearing shoes I can walk in. Here’s proof: Here’s it all bundled up and ready to go! Let’s break it down! Here are the things I like to bring if we’re eating. Picnic Food Stuff: plastic utensils– these are actually plastic. You can recycle them when done or rewash them. They’re fancy enough to save. plastic cups- bring a few extra so you can have water for watercoloring! cutting board knife- get yourself a knife with a cover! Mine is wooden, but I also recommend these ones too! They’re so sharp. garbage bag – clean up your mess!! Always carry a baggie with you. enamelware storage bowls– bring food in them and then use them to store leftovers enamel plates– so durable!!! napkins/dish towel– clean up after yourselves! When you’re prepared, you can have a feast as we see above! Bringing food that needs to stay cold? Bring a cooler! I got this one in an influencer package, and it has served me well over the years! Always make sure you bring water! When you have a cutting board and a knife, you open yourself to many possibilities. Cheese and crackers? No problem. Want to cut that apple you brought so we can serve it with the cheese? We are covered! You brought a salami you cured and a baguette? WE ARE PREPARED. If you like keeping things separate and in compartments, maybe pack some bento boxes.
excerpt: Plan the perfect picnic with The Ultimate Picnic Packing List from Shutterbean. This comprehensive guide includes food ideas, essential gear, and helpful tips to keep your outdoor meals fun, organized, and stress-free.
text: After many years of tinkering, I finally created what I consider the Ultimate Picnic Packing List to reference whenever I pack a picnic.  As always, I separated my list into Must Haves/ Do You Needs?  If you are planning any type of picnic adventure, go to the START here section of The Ultimate Picnic Packing List!  ASK YOURSELF: Who is going? Not on the list, but you know, you should know.  Where is your picnic? How long will it last?  What’s the weather? Here are all of my essentials!  a sun hat!  a picnic basket – Mine is an old shopping basket.  a beach towel – helps with cleanup, can also be a blanket or tablecloth if need be!  a blanket (that rolls up!)– always important to have one. I actually leave one in my car at all times. You never know!  portable Bluetooth speaker (it has a battery pack!) food bag art supply bag essentials dopp kit cooler bag  I can carry it all from the car to our destination. I’m wearing shoes I can walk in.  Here’s proof:  Here’s it all bundled up and ready to go!  Let’s break it down! Here are the things I like to bring if we’re eating.  Picnic Food Stuff:  plastic utensils– these are actually plastic. You can recycle them when done or rewash them. They’re fancy enough to save.  plastic cups- bring a few extra so you can have water for watercoloring!  cutting board knife- get yourself a knife with a cover! Mine is wooden, but I also recommend these ones too! They’re so sharp.  garbage bag – clean up your mess!! Always carry a baggie with you.  enamelware storage bowls– bring food in them and then use them to store leftovers  enamel plates– so durable!!!  napkins/dish towel– clean up after yourselves!  When you’re prepared, you can have a feast as we see above! Bringing food that needs to stay cold? Bring a cooler! I got this one in an influencer package, and it has served me well over the years!  Always make sure you bring water!   When you have a cutting board and a knife, you open yourself to many possibilities. Cheese and crackers? No problem. Want to cut that apple you brought so we can serve it with the cheese? We are covered!  You brought a salami you cured and a baguette?  WE ARE PREPARED.  If you like keeping things separate and in compartments, maybe pack some bento boxes.  I like to use deli containers to pack stuff up in, too.  Here’s a pro-tip! Wrap your plates with a dish towel/napkin you’re using. If you can’t wash your plate while you’re out, it’s easy to wrap the plates back up with your towel and deal with them when you get home. It will keep your dirty plates protected from the rest of the stuff in your bag.  Of course, I am going to bring some art stuff with me.  Art stuff includes: watercolor palette  my favorite brush pens favorite pens a stack of index cards  playing cards! (you can see how I pack a day adventure bag here!)  I also brought my essentials bag, which has a bunch of things in it like: Bag of Tricks: bandana first aid kit wipes advil aquaphor sunscreen lotion sunscreen stick tissues rosewater spray hand sanitizer (ignore the handwarmers- those are for baseball!)  With a well-prepared arsenal, life can be pretty amazing on the go!  Oh! I forgot to add- check the wind!  You might need some heavy rocks to hold things down.  Now that we know what we need to bring, here are some Picnic Food Ideas! tshit If you need me…find me under a ring of redwoods.  I packed us lunch!      What is on the Ultimate Picnic Packing List for you?? Am I missing something?
html:
After many years of tinkering, I finally created what I consider the Ultimate Picnic Packing List to reference whenever I pack a picnic. 

As always, I separated my list into

Must Haves/ Do You Needs? 

If you are planning any type of picnic adventure, go to the START here section of The Ultimate Picnic Packing List! 

ASK YOURSELF:

Who is going? Not on the list, but you know, you should know. 

Where is your picnic?

How long will it last? 

What’s the weather?

Here are all of my essentials! 

  • a sun hat! 
  • a picnic basket – Mine is an old shopping basket. 
  • a beach towel – helps with cleanup, can also be a blanket or tablecloth if need be! 
  • a blanket (that rolls up!)– always important to have one. I actually leave one in my car at all times. You never know! 
  • portable Bluetooth speaker (it has a battery pack!)
  • food bag
  • art supply bag
  • essentials dopp kit
  • cooler bag 

I can carry it all from the car to our destination. I’m wearing shoes I can walk in.  Here’s proof: 

Here’s it all bundled up and ready to go! 

Let’s break it down! Here are the things I like to bring if we’re eating. 

Picnic Food Stuff: 

  • plastic utensils– these are actually plastic. You can recycle them when done or rewash them. They’re fancy enough to save. 
  • plastic cups- bring a few extra so you can have water for watercoloring! 
  • cutting board
  • knife- get yourself a knife with a cover! Mine is wooden, but I also recommend these ones too! They’re so sharp. 
  • garbage bag – clean up your mess!! Always carry a baggie with you. 
  • enamelware storage bowls– bring food in them and then use them to store leftovers 
  • enamel plates– so durable!!! 
  • napkins/dish towel– clean up after yourselves! 

When you’re prepared, you can have a feast as we see above!

Bringing food that needs to stay cold? Bring a cooler! I got this one in an influencer package, and it has served me well over the years! 

Always make sure you bring water!  

When you have a cutting board and a knife, you open yourself to many possibilities. Cheese and crackers? No problem. Want to cut that apple you brought so we can serve it with the cheese? We are covered!  You brought a salami you cured and a baguette?  WE ARE PREPARED. 

If you like keeping things separate and in compartments, maybe pack some bento boxes. 

I like to use deli containers to pack stuff up in, too. 

Here’s a pro-tip! Wrap your plates with a dish towel/napkin you’re using. If you can’t wash your plate while you’re out, it’s easy to wrap the plates back up with your towel and deal with them when you get home. It will keep your dirty plates protected from the rest of the stuff in your bag. 

Of course, I am going to bring some art stuff with me. 

Art stuff includes:

  • watercolor palette 
  • my favorite brush pens
  • favorite pens
  • a stack of index cards 
  • playing cards!

(you can see how I pack a day adventure bag here!) 

I also brought my essentials bag, which has a bunch of things in it like:

Bag of Tricks:

  • bandana
  • first aid kit
  • wipes
  • advil
  • aquaphor
  • sunscreen lotion
  • sunscreen stick
  • tissues
  • rosewater spray
  • hand sanitizer

(ignore the handwarmers- those are for baseball!) 

With a well-prepared arsenal, life can be pretty amazing on the go! 

Oh! I forgot to add- check the wind! 

You might need some heavy rocks to hold things down. 

Now that we know what we need to bring, here are some Picnic Food Ideas! tshit

If you need me…find me under a ring of redwoods.

 I packed us lunch!     

What is on the Ultimate Picnic Packing List for you?? Am I missing something?
